intro: Iberis tenoreana proles gastonis, commonly known as the Corsican candytuft, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is characterized by its dense, low-growing habit. Its flowers are white or pale yellow, and it produces small, rounded seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
